content.content:
After more than twenty years together, Taís Araujo and Lázaro Ramos, one of the most influential couples in contemporary Brazilian culture, decided to create a home from scratch that could represent their family's lifestyle and personality. 

“We wanted to give ourselves the gift of having the home of our dreams. After all, we deserve it,” says Taís Araujo to Casa Vogue.

Brazilianness in every detail


The new apartment is a celebration of Brazilianness in its most sophisticated form. With a project signed by architects Carolina Escada and Patricia Landau, from Escala Arquitetura, the space values family living and translates the couple's vibrant personality through integrated welcoming, and elegant environments.


Among the central elements of the project are Breton's exclusive design pieces, carefully chosen to compose the couple's new home. The furniture combines style, functionality, and authenticity, and was specially customized to meet the needs of the project.

content.text:
Desejo Sofa and Sintonia Armchair: designed by Luisa Moysés


In the living area, the Desejo sofa and Sintonia armchair, both designed by Luisa Moysés, stand out for their organic and welcoming design. With smooth curves and generous proportions, the pieces create an environment that is both comfortable and imposing — ideal for family moments or entertaining friends with elegance.

content.content:
The Bumbo Armchair, by Lilly Sarti

Another highlight of the environment is the Bumbo armchair, created by designer Lilly Sarti for Breton in a pink finish. The piece represents the union between fashion and furniture, bringing sophistication and personality with a striking contemporary touch.

The project also features the Galhos side table, designed by Fernanda Marques, and the Caetano coffee table, by Giácomo Tomazzi — two pieces that function as sculptures within the environment. Both bear the signature of renowned names in national design and reinforce the project's proposal: to unite aesthetics and functionality with originality.


Every choice made for Taís and Lázaro's new home represents a dialogue between identity and style. The strong presence of contemporary Brazilian design — represented by Breton's exclusive collections — reinforces the appreciation of local culture through furniture.
